citations.narrative:
At approximately 11:30am, staff were preparing rabbits for a surgical procedure on an IACUC approved protocol. Two
rabbits were observed in a set of 8 metal transport enclosures, each enclosure with approximately 0.9 sq ft of floor space.
On discussion with research staff, rabbits were housed in the transport enclosures since they were transferred from the
housing room at approximately 8am that morning. Rabbits were housed in enclosures that did not meet the minimum
amount of floor space for this species.
While animals are being housed, adequate floor space is necessary to allow the rabbits to make normal postural and
social adjustments with adequate freedom of movement. Each rabbit housed in a primary enclosure shall be provided the
minimum amount of floor space appropriate for the animal’s weight, per this regulation.
Corrected at the time of inspection by housing rabbits in appropriately sized primary enclosures. To remain corrected after
July 10th, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Michael Brooks, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
